text: Cell - specific expression of helix-loop-helix transcription factors encoded by the <extra_id_0> E2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .

The <extra_id_0> E2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene encodes transcription factors of the helix-loop-helix family that are implicated in cell - specific gene expression as part of dimeric complexes that interact with E box enhancer elements .
It has previously been shown that transcripts of the <extra_id_0> E2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene can be detected in a wide range of cell types .

We have now examined expression of the mouse <extra_id_0> E2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene at the protein level using polyclonal antisera directed against distinct portions of the <extra_id_0> E2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein to probe blots of cellular extracts .
A 73 kDa protein was identified by this analysis : this protein is highly enriched in cell lines of B lymphoid origin as compared to pancreatic beta-cells and fibroblast cells .

The detection of this protein selectively in extracts of lymphoid cells correlates with the presence of the E box - binding activity LEF1 / BCF1 in these cells ; this binding activity was previously shown to be efficiently recognized by antiserum directed against <extra_id_0> E2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene products .

Transfection of cells with full length <extra_id_0> E2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cDNA leads to appearance of protein co - migrating with the 73 kDa protein on SDS gel electrophoresis and co - migrating with LEF1 / BCF1 on mobility shift analysis .

text: Our results are consistent with the view that the DNA - binding activity LEF1 / BCF1 is a homodimer of <extra_id_0> E2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins ; the selective appearance of this putative cell - specific transcription factor in B lymphoid cells seems to be attributable , at least in part , to the elevated <extra_id_0> E2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein concentrations in these cells .
